item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, March 12, 2025 at 6:25 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Happy 20th Birthday, Y Combinator (1095 points | 214 comments)
2. Beyond Diffusion: Inductive Moment Matching (56 points | 10 comments)
3. Show HN: VSC – An open source 3D Rendering Engine in C++ (37 points | 4 comments)
4. The Startup CTO's Handbook (202 points | 43 comments)
5. Internationalization-puzzles: Daily programming puzzles just like Advent of Code (36 points | discuss)
6. Fastplotlib: GPU-accelerated, fast, and interactive plotting library (375 points | 134 comments)
7. New tools for building agents (313 points | 116 comments)
8. Show HN: Factorio Learning Environment – Agents Build Factories (649 points | 186 comments)
9. Happy 10k Day (102 points | 59 comments)
10. Show HN: XPipe, a shell connection hub for SSH, Docker, K8s, VMs, and more (21 points | 10 comments)
11. NASA to launch space observatory that will map 450M galaxies (205 points | 73 comments)
12. The Insecurity of Telecom Stacks in the Wake of Salt Typhoon (7 points | discuss)
13. Sorting algorithms with CUDA (79 points | 19 comments)
14. Launch HN: Sift Dev (YC W25) – AI-Powered Datadog Alternative (65 points | 45 comments)
15. A 10x Faster TypeScript (1533 points | 691 comments)
16. Australian man survives 100 days with artificial heart (159 points | 40 comments)
17. The US island that speaks Elizabethan English (220 points | 123 comments)
18. AI-Generated Voice Evidence Poses Dangers in Court (136 points | 94 comments)
19. In contrast to Earth, Mars's middle atmosphere appears driven by gravity waves (61 points | 20 comments)
20. Show HN: Krep a High-Performance String Search Utility Written in C (133 points | 54 comments)
21. What makes code hard to read: Visual patterns of complexity (2023) (307 points | 298 comments)
22. The Early History of Deferred Shading and Lighting (20 points | 2 comments)
23. When Crocodiles Attack: The Ramree Island Massacre (2013) (51 points | 55 comments)
24. Continue (YC S23) Is Hiring a Software Engineer in San Francisco ( | hide)
25. NIST selects HQC as fifth algorithm for post-quantum encryption (146 points | 101 comments)
26. Modern Baby: A pioneering computer from Manchester (60 points | 7 comments)
27. A look at the creative process behind Bluey and Cocomelon (2024) (70 points | 56 comments)
28. Tesco trials giant trolley scales in Gateshead (17 points | 35 comments)
29. Show HN: Daylight – track sunrise / sunset times in your terminal (15 points | 2 comments)
30. America Is Missing The New Labor Economy – Robotics Part 1 (178 points | 272 comments)
